docs.lead_paragraph: South Korea's rapidly mending banking industry has its sights set on a milestone moment expected six months from now, when the government-run Korea Asset Management Corporation will stop buying any more nonperforming loans and the industry will be certifiably off the disabled list. The asset management company, known as Kamco, was set up at the height of the crisis to relieve the banks of their worst mistakes -- loan after loan bestowed on affiliate companies of the country's sprawling chaebol conglomerates with no heed to collateral quality or creditworthiness -- which had threatened to drag the whole industry into insolvency.

headline.main: Rescue Winding Down for Korea Banks

docs.abstract: Government-run Korea Asset Management Corp will stop buying any more nonperforming loans in six months and banking industry will be certifiably off disabled list; South Korea's banking industry was profitable in 2001, for first time since crisis, and its financial health has improved to point that Korea Asset Management has begun phasing itself out; graph (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: Gov. Ronnie Musgrove said he would call a special legislative session this summer to deal with rapidly rising medical malpractice insurance premiums, which some contend have led some physicians to retire or move. Mr. Musgrove, a Democrat, acted in response to complaints that the insurance is no longer affordable because Mississippi juries have been too generous.

headline.main: National Briefing | South: Mississippi: Action On Malpractice Premiums

docs.abstract: Mississippi Gov Ronnie Musgrove says he will call special legislative session this summer to deal with rapidly rising medical malpractice insurance premiums (S)

docs.lead_paragraph: The nonprofit sector is the fastest-growing source of jobs in New York City, according to a new study of the sector's economic role. The study shows that unlike other business sectors, the nonprofit sector has been a steady and growing source of jobs for a decade, a finding confirmed by economists and labor analysts.

headline.main: Nonprofit Sector of City Economy Is Fastest-Growing Source of Jobs, a Study Reports

docs.abstract: Study finds nonprofit sector is fastest-growing source of jobs in New York City, and has been for past decade; sector is now third-largest, employing 14 percent of work force, exceeded only by wholesale/retail and government (M)
